meanings.definition: The condition of having multiple sets of chromosomes within a single cell.
meanings.sent1: Endopolyploidies can result in cells with extra genetic material.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study endopolyploidies to understand how cells can have more chromosomes than usual.
meanings.sent3: The endopolyploidies in the cell made it look like a genetic treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: Her cells were like a library full of endopolyploidies, each book representing a set of chromosomes.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the endopolyploidies were like colorful beads, each one holding genetic information.

meanings.definition: The process of cells undergoing endoreduplication to increase their DNA content.
meanings.sent1: Endopolyploidies occur when cells duplicate their DNA multiple times.
meanings.sent2: During endopolyploidies, cells go through a cycle of DNA replication.
meanings.sent3: The cell's endopolyploidies seemed to be on a DNA copying spree.
meanings.sent4: Her cells were like factories in overdrive, producing endopolyploidies of DNA.
meanings.sent5: The endopolyploidies in the cell were like a growing library of genetic information.

meanings.definition: The study of polyploid organisms that have multiple sets of chromosomes within their cells.
meanings.sent1: Endopolyploidies research focuses on organisms with extra chromosome sets.
meanings.sent2: Scientists in the field of endopolyploidies study how organisms manage multiple chromosome sets.
meanings.sent3: The endopolyploidies research group had a lot of genetic puzzles to solve.
meanings.sent4: In the world of genetics, endopolyploidies were like a complex jigsaw puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The study of endopolyploidies revealed the intricate genetic makeup of organisms.
